  df

                    		
                  

                  

                    250
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    251
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    252
                    
                    
                      
#' add_anbr

                    		
                  

                  

                    253
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    254
                    
                    
                      
#' Adds or updates anbr counter field in `df` which comes from `anbr_counter`

                    		
                  

                  

                    255
                    
                    
                      
#' variable in `env`

                    		
                  

                  

                    256
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    257
                    
                    
                      
#' @param df dataframe

                    		
                  

                  

                    258
                    
                    
                      
#' @param env environment

                    		
                  

                  

                    259
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    260
                    
                    
                      
#' @return df with rowby row header added

                    		
                  

                  

                    261
                    
                    
                      
#' @noRd

                    		
                  

                  

                    262
                    
                    
                      
add_anbr <- function(df, env = parent.frame()) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    263
                    
                    
                      
  # check if the counter variable exists in the specified env

                    		
                  

                  

                    264
                    23x
                    
                      
  if (!exists("anbr_counter", envir = env)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    265
                    
                    
                      
    # set up anbr counter to be used later

                    		
                  

                  

                    266
                    10x
                    
                      
    assign("anbr_counter", 0, envir = env)

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    268
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    269
                    
                    
                      
  # check if anbr has been added or if it's not a valid numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    270
                    23x
                    
                      
  if ("anbr" %in% names(df) &&

                    		
                  

                  

                    271
                    23x
                    
                      
    !all(is.na(suppressWarnings(as.numeric(df[["anbr"]]))))) { # nolint indentation_linter

                    		
                  

                  

                    272
                    
                    
                      
    # update counter to be the max anbr in the input df for future layers

                    		
                  

                  

                    273
                    5x
                    
                      
    anbr_values <- df[["anbr"]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    274
                    5x
                    
                      
    assign("anbr_counter",

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    5x
                    
                      
      max(c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    276
                    5x
                    
                      
        suppressWarnings(as.numeric(df[["anbr"]])),

                    		
                  

                  

                    277
                    5x
                    
                      
        get("anbr_counter", envir = env) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    278
                    5x
                    
                      
      ), na.rm = TRUE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    279
                    5x
                    
                      
      envir = env

                    		
                  

                  

                    280
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    281
                    
                    
                      
    # return df

                    		
                  

                  

                    282
                    5x
                    
                      
    df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    283
                    5x
                    
                      
      select(-"anbr") %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    284
                    5x
                    
                      
      mutate(anbr = suppressWarnings(as.numeric(anbr_values)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    285
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    286
                    18x
                    
                      
    if ("anbr" %in% names(df)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    287
                    2x
                    
                      
      df <- df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    288
                    2x
                    
                      
        select(-"anbr")

                    		
                  

                  

                    289
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    290
                    
                    
                      
    # get the value from the parent env

                    		
                  

                  

                    291
                    18x
                    
                      
    anbr_value <- get("anbr_counter", envir = env) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    292
                    
                    
                      
    # increment the anbr_counter

                    		
                  

                  

                    293
                    18x
                    
                      
    assign("anbr_counter", anbr_value, envir = env)

                    		
                  

                  

                    294
                    
                    
                      
    # return df with anbr added

                    		
                  

                  

                    295
                    18x
                    
                      
    df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    296
                    18x
                    
                      
      mutate(anbr = anbr_value)

                    		
                  

                  

                    297
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    298
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    299
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    300
                    
                    
                      
#' get_tby_denoms

                    		
                  

                  

                    301
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    302
                    
                    
                      
#' Filters _denoms for current tablebyvar in `cur_tby` var

                    		
                  

                  

                    303
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    304
                    
                    
                      
#' @param denoms_ denominator

                    		
                  

                  

                    305
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tablebyvar repeat entire table by variable within df

                    		
                  

                  

                    306
                    
                    
                      
#' @param cur_tby current by

                    		
                  

                  

                    307
                    
                    
                      
#' @param colvar treatment variable within df to use to summarize

                    		
                  

                  

                    308
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    309
                    
                    
                      
#' @return `denoms_` filtered for tablebyvar

                    		
                  

                  

                    310
                    
                    
                      
#' @noRd

                    		
                  

                  

                    311
                    
                    
                      
get_tby_denoms <- function(denoms_, tablebyvar, cur_tby, colvar) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    312
                    3x
                    
                      
  tmp <- denoms_ %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    313
                    3x
                    
                      
    filter(!!sym(paste0("denom_", tablebyvar)) == as.character(cur_tby))

                    		
                  

                  

                    314
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    315
                    3x
                    
                      
  cur_denoms <- tmp %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    316
                    3x
                    
                      
    extract2("denom") %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    317
                    3x
                    
                      
    as.character()

                    		
                  

                  

                    318
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    319
                    3x
                    
                      
  names(cur_denoms) <- tmp[[paste0("denom_", colvar)]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    320
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    321
                    3x
                    
                      
  cur_denoms

                    		
                  

                  

                    322
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @title getFileName

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description This function returns the file path up until the program's

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'   name.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @author Steven haesendonckx {shaesen2@@its.jnj.com}

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @return The file path up untill the program's name.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param file name of the file

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @noRd

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
get_file_name <- function() {

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
  ##### If run from MCD BATCH\

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    !
                    
                      
  file_name <- get_file_name_batch(commandArgs(trailingOnly = FALSE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!is.null(file_name)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    !
                    
                      
    return(file_name)

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
  #### If Run from Source

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    !
                    
                      
  ret <- base::sys.frame(1)$ofile # gets file path of sourced file

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!is.null(ret)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    !
                    
                      
    return(stringr::str_replace(ret, "~", base::path.expand("~")))

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
  ### If Run from rstudio server console

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    !
                    
                      
  if (rstudioapi::isAvailable()) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
    # Gets file path of current active Rstuido editor

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    !
                    
                      
    ret <- rstudioapi::getSourceEditorContext()$path

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    !
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(ret)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    !
                    
                      
      return(stringr::str_replace(ret, "~", base::path.expand("~")))

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    !
                    
                      
  NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @noRd

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
get_file_name_batch <- function(cmd_args) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    3x
                    
                      
  res <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
  # Update to use logrx over timber

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    3x
                    
                      
  timber_needle <- "logrx::axecute"

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    3x
                    
                      
  timber_match <- base::grep(timber_needle, cmd_args)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    3x
                    
                      
  file_needle <- "--file="

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    3x
                    
                      
  file_match <- base::grep(file_needle, cmd_args)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    3x
                    
                      
  if (any(timber_match)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    2x
                    
                      
    file_arg <- stringr::str_extract(

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2x
                    
                      
      cmd_args[timber_match],

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2x
                    
                      
      'file~\\+~\\=~\\+~"(.+?)"'

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (!is.na(file_arg)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    1x
                    
                      
      file_arg2 <- stringr::str_extract(file_arg, '"(.+?)"')

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1x
                    
                      
      res <- normalizePath(gsub("\"", "", file_arg2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    1x
                    
                      
      try(

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
        {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1x
                    
                      
          res <- rlang::call_args(str2lang(cmd_args[timber_match]))$file

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
        },

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1x
                    
                      
        silent = TRUE

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    1x
                    
                      
  } else if (any(file_match)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1x
                    
                      
    res <- normalizePath(sub(file_needle, "", cmd_args[file_match]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    3x
                    
                      
  res

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Add the formatting variables of `indentme`, `newrows`, `newpage`, and `roworder` to

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' the results dataframe

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' @param df (required) dataframe of results and must contain the `anbr` variable.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tableby (optional) character vector containing table by variables.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param groupby (optional) character vector containing group by variables.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param .keep (optional) should `tableby` and `groupby` variables be kept in the

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   final dataframe. (default = `FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return dataframe with the formatting variables `indentme`, `newrows`, `newpage`, and `roworder` added.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom purrr walk

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom rlang sym

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' df <- tibble::tibble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   row_type =

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'     c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'       "TABLE_BY_HEADER", "HEADER", "BY_HEADER1", "N", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'       "COUNTS", "UNIVAR", "NESTED", "NESTED"

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'     ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   nested_level = c(NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 1, 2),

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   group_level = c(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0),

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   label = c(NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "N", NA, NA, NA),

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   by = c(NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA),

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'   tableby = c(NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA),

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'   anbr = c(1:9)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' add_format(df)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
add_format <- function(df, tableby = NULL, groupby = NULL, .keep = FALSE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
  # check all the arguments being passed in except ...

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    17x
                    
                      
  arglist <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    17x
                    
                      
  args_to_chk <- names(formals())[names(formals()) != "..."]

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    17x
                    
                      
  walk(args_to_chk, .f = function(x) arglist[[x]] <<- eval(sym(x)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    17x
                    
                      
  check_add_format(arglist)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    10x
                    
                      
  df2 <- df |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    10x
                    
                      
    add_indent() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    10x
                    
                      
    add_newrows(tableby = tableby, groupby = groupby) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    10x
                    
                      
    add_newpage()

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    10x
                    
                      
  if (is.null(c(tableby, groupby)) || .keep == TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    4x
                    
                      
    df2

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    6x
                    
                      
    df2 |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    6x
                    
                      
      select(-all_of(c(tableby, groupby)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
# Function that sets when a new page is to be added

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
# A new page is added when row_type is TABLE_BY_HEADER and not the first row

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
# but when first row instead adds a new row

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' add_newpage

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' @param df dataframe to add newpage col to

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' @return df with the newpage cols row added and newrows updated

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' @noRd

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
add_newpage <- function(df) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    10x
                    
                      
  if (any(df[["row_type"]] == "TABLE_BY_HEADER")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    4x
                    
                      
    df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    4x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    4x
                    
                      
        newpage = case_when(

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    4x
                    
                      
          row_type == "TABLE_BY_HEADER" &

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    4x
                    
                      
            dplyr::row_number() > 1 ~ 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    4x
                    
                      
          TRUE ~ 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
        ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    4x
                    
                      
        newrows = case_when(

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    4x
                    
                      
          row_type == "TABLE_BY_HEADER" &

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    4x
                    
                      
            dplyr::row_number() == 1 ~ 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    4x
                    
                      
          row_type == "TABLE_BY_HEADER" &

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    4x
                    
                      
            dplyr::row_number() > 1 ~ 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    4x
                    
                      
          TRUE ~ newrows

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    6x
                    
                      
    df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    6x
                    
                      
      mutate(newpage = 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Get Titles and Footnotes for all TLGs or one specific TLG

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @param df dataframe with three variables; table name, row identifier (`TITLE`

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'   or `FOOTNOTEn`), and title or footnote text to display.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tblid  character vector containing the table id, optional, used to

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'   subset `df` to a specific table (defaults to `tblid`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param idvar  character vector containing the variable in `df` that contains

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   your table id.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param identifier character vector containing the variable name in `df` that

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'   contains your record identifier (defaults to "identifier").

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param text  character vector containing the variable name in `df` that

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   contains your title and footnote text (defaults to "text").

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return list of length two, the first element contains the titles

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   as a `tibble` and the second contains the footnotes as a list.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' tblid <- "TSIDEM01"

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' titles <- tibble::tribble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   ~tblid, ~identifier, ~text,

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   "TSIDEM01", "TITLE", "Demographics Example",

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   "TSIDEM01", "FOOTNOTE1", "Example footnote."

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' title_foot <- rmdpstitle(titles, tblid)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' title_foot[[1]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' title_foot[[2]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
rmdpstitle <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
  function(df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
           tblid,

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
           idvar = "tblid",

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
           identifier = "identifier",

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
           text = "text") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
    # function argument checks

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    !
                    
                      
    rlang::check_required(df)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    !
                    
                      
    rlang::check_required(tblid)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    !
                    
                      
    if (!(identifier %in% names(df))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    !
                    
                      
      cli::cli_abort("{identifier} is not in {substitute(df)}")

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    !
                    
                      
    if (!(text %in% names(df))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    !
                    
                      
      cli::cli_abort("{text} is not in {substitute(df)}")

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
    # split titles and footnotes into separate objects

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    !
                    
                      
    ttl <- df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::filter(.data[[identifier]] == "TITLE")

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    !
                    
                      
    foot <- df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::filter(.data[[identifier]] != "TITLE")

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    !
                    
                      
    if (!(tblid %in% unique(df[[idvar]]))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    !
                    
                      
      cli::cli_abort("{tblid} is not in

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    !
                    
                      
                     {substitute(df)}${substitute(idvar)}")

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    !
                    
                      
    ttl <- ttl %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::filter_at(idvar, ~ . == tblid) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::select(.data[[text]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    !
                    
                      
    foot <- foot %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::filter_at(idvar, ~ . == tblid) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::select(.data[[text]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
    # return NULL for titles and/or footnotes if none are found

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    !
                    
                      
    if (nrow(ttl) == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    !
                    
                      
      ttl <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    !
                    
                      
    if (nrow(foot) == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    !
                    
                      
      foot <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    !
                    
                      
      foot <- split(foot$text, seq_len(nrow(foot)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    !
                    
                      
    return(list(ttl, foot))

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Spanning headers for outputs

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' This will create the list object to be passed to `gentlg()` You can create as

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' many spanning headers as you like, just add variables prefixed with span to

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' the column metadata.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param column_metadata dataframe containing the column metadata that is

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   passed to `tlgsetup()` (see `tlgsetup()` for details)

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List of character vectors containing column headers for an output.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' column_metadata <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   tibble::tribble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'     ~tbltype, ~coldef, ~decode,                ~span1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'     "type1",  "0",     "Placebo",              "",

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'     "type1",  "54",    "Low Dose",             "Xanomeline",

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'     "type1",  "81",    "High Dose",            "Xanomeline",

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'     "type1",  "54+81", "Total Xanomeline",     ""

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' spanning_headers(column_metadata)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
spanning_headers <- function(column_metadata) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    5x
                    
                      
  span_element <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    6x
                    
                      
    c("", stringr::str_replace_na(x, ""))

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    5x
                    
                      
  not_empty <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    23x
                    
                      
    !all(is.na(x) | is.null(x) | x == "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    5x
                    
                      
  span <- column_metadata %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    5x
                    
                      
    dplyr::select_if(not_empty) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    5x
                    
                      
    dplyr::select(dplyr::starts_with("span")) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    5x
                    
                      
    lapply(span_element)

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    2x
                    
                      
  if (length(span) == 0) (span <- NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    5x
                    
                      
  span

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' `tidytlg`: A package for producing tables, listings,

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'  and graphs (`TLGs`) using `tidyverse` packages.

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' The `tidytlg` package provide a set of function allowing you to produce TLGs

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' using table metadata.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @section `tidytlg` Options:

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' \itemize{ \item{`tidytlg.row_type.levels` - The values of row_type and their

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' respective levels. Default: c("TABLE_BY_HEADER", "BY_HEADER1", "BY_HEADER2",

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' "BY_HEADER3", "BY_HEADER4", "BY_HEADER5", "HEADER", "N", "VALUE", "NESTED")}

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.fontsize.title` - Font size for titles in points. Default: 10}

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.fontsize.table.footnote` - Font size for footnotes in points.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' For tables. Default: 9} \item{`tidytlg.fontsize.listing.footnote` - Font size

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' for footnotes in points. For listings. Default: 8}

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.fontsize.graph.footnote` - Font size for footnotes in points.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' For graphs. Default: 8} \item{`tidytlg.fontsize.table` - Font size for tables

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' in points. Default: 9} \item{`tidytlg.fontsize.graph` - Font size for graphs in

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' points. Default: 10} \item{`tidytlg.fontsize.listing` - Font size for listings

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' in points. Default: 8} \item{`tidytlg.right.padding` - Amount of right padding

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' for cells in points. Default: 1} \item{`tidytlg.left.padding` - Amount of left

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' padding for cells in points. Default: 1}

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.stat_labels` - Labels

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' to be used for each summary statistic in the output table.  Will need to have

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' all available statistics if this option is changed!}

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.precision.extra` - Value to be added on for each summary

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' statistic when calculating precision.  This will be used to make different

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' statistics have different precision as needed}

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.nested_freq.statlist.default` - Default `statlist` object for

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' nested_freq tables. Default: `statlist("n (x.x)")`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.univar.statlist.default` - Default `statlist` object

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' for `univar` tables.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' Default: `statlist(c("N", "MEANSD", "MEDIAN", "RANGE", "IQRANGE"))`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.freq.statlist.default` - Default `statlist` object

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' for frequency tables. Default: `statlist("n (x.x)")`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.stat_labels` - A `data.frame` controlling how the stats

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' are labeled in a `univar` table. See 'Default Stat Labels' section

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' for defaults.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{`tidytlg.denoms.message` - A `boolean`, should a message print

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' detailing what the denominators are?}

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @section Default Stat Labels:

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' | **stat** | **label** |

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' | --- | --- |

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' | `N` | N |

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' | `SUM` | Sum |

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MEAN` | Mean |

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' | `GeoMEAN` | Geometric Mean |

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' | `SD` | Std. Deviation |

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' | `SE` | Std. Error |

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' | `GSD` | Geometric Std. Deviation |

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' | `GSE` | Geometric Std. Error |

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' | `CV` | CV |

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MEANSD` | Mean (SD) |

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MEANSE` | Mean (SE) |

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MEDIAN` | Median |

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MIN` | Minimum |

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MAX` | Maximum |

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#' | `RANGE` | Range |

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' | `Q1` | First quartile |

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#' | `Q3` | Third quartile |

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#' | `IQRANGE` | IQ range |

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MEDRANGE` | Median (Range) |

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MEDIQRANGE` | Median (Q1; Q3) |

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' | `MEAN_CI` | Mean (95% C.I.) |

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#' | `GeoMEAN_CI` | Geometric Mean (95% C.I.) |

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#' @section Default Precision Extra:

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#' | **stat** | **extra** |

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#' | --- | --- |

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
#' |`N` | 0 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
#' |`SUM`| 0 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
#' |`MEAN`| 1 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
#' |`GeoMEAN`| 1 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
#' |`SD`| 2 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#' |`SE`| 2 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
#' |`GSD`| 2 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
#' |`GSE`| 2 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
#' |`CV`| 1 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
#' |`MEDIAN`| 1 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
#' |`MIN`| 0 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
#' |`MAX`| 0 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
#' |`Q1`| 1 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#' |`Q3`| 1 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#' |`LCL_MEAN`| 2 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
#' |`UCL_MEAN`| 2 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
#' |`LCL_GeoMEAN`| 2 |
