                    91
                    
                    
                      
#' |`UCL_GeoMEAN`| 2 |

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
#' @section Updating Options:

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
#' \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{For a single session, an option can be changed by

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
#'   `option(<optionToChange> = <NewValue>)`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{To change an option for a single projects across sessions in that

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
#'   projects, place the options update in the `.Rprofile` in that project

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
#'   directory.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{To change an option for a user across all sessions, place the options

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
#'   update in the `.Rprofile` file in the users home directory.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{To change an option for all users in an R environment, place the

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
#'   options update in the `.Rprofile.site` file in the R home directory.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
#' @name tidytlg

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
"_PACKAGE"

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
utils::globalVariables(c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
  "anbr", "label", "rowvar", "rowcondition", "row_type",

  "rowtext", "tableby", "by", "func", "colvar", "header_order",

                    116
                    
                    
                      
  "tbltype", "dotdotdot",

  ".", "name", "alpha", "value", "N", "pct", "denom", "results",

  "n_ord", "n_ord2", "n_ord3", "data_nest", "nested_treatment",

#' @importFrom rlang enexprs is_call expr sym %||% exprs syms as_string is_named

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
#'   eval_tidy enexpr as_name .data :=

                    		
                  

                  

                    127

                    128
                    
                    
                      
#'   replace_na crossing fill

                    		
                  

                  

                    129

#'   bind_cols

                    132

#'   row_number

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom dplyr group_by_at slice mutate_if

                    137

#' @importFrom dplyr all_of any_of everything starts_with ends_with

#' @importFrom forcats fct_expand fct_recode fct_relevel

.onLoad <- function(libname, pkgname) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    !
                    
                      
  op <- options()

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    !
                    
                      
  op_tidytlg <- list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.row_type.levels =

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    !
                    
                      
      c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    !
                    
                      
        "TABLE_BY_HEADER",

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    !
                    
                      
        "BY_HEADER1", "BY_HEADER2", "BY_HEADER3", "BY_HEADER4", "BY_HEADER5",

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    !
                    
                      
        "HEADER",

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    !
                    
                      
        "N", "VALUE", "NESTED"

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      
      ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.fontsize.title = 10,

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.fontsize.table.footnote = 9,

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.fontsize.listing.footnote = 8,

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.fontsize.graph.footnote = 8,

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.fontsize.table = 9,

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.fontsize.graph = 10,

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.fontsize.listing = 8,

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.right.padding = 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.left.padding = 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.stat_labels = tibble::tribble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    !
                    
                      
      ~stat,           ~label,

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    !
                    
                      
      "N",             "N",

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    !
                    
                      
      "SUM",           "Sum",

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    !
                    
                      
      "MEAN",          "Mean",

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    !
                    
                      
      "GeoMEAN",       "Geometric Mean",

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    !
                    
                      
      "SD",            "Std. Dev.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    !
                    
                      
      "SE",            "Std. Error",

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    !
                    
                      
      "GSD",           "Geometric Std. Dev.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    !
                    
                      
      "GSE",           "Geometric Std. Error",

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    !
                    
                      
      "CV",            "CV (%)",

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    !
                    
                      
      "MEANSD",        "Mean (SD)",

                    !
                    
                      
      "MEANSE",        "Mean (SE)",

                    !
                    
                      
      "MEDIAN",        "Median",

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    !
                    
                      
      "MIN",           "Minimum",

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    !
                    
                      
      "MAX",           "Maximum",

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    !
                    
                      
      "RANGE",         "Range",

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    !
                    
                      
      "Q1",            "First quartile",

      "Q3",            "Third quartile",

      "IQRANGE",       "IQ range",

                    !
                    
                      
      "MEDRANGE",      "Median (Range)",

                    !

                    201

                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.precision.extra = tibble::tribble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    !
                    
                      
      ~stat,           ~extra,

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    !
                    
                      
      "N",             0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    !
                    
                      
      "SUM",           0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    !
                    
                      
      "MEAN",          1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    !
                    
                      
      "GeoMEAN",       1,

                    !
                    
                      
      "SD",            2,

      "GSE",           2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    !
                    
                      
      "CV",            1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    !
                    
                      
      "MEDIAN",        1,

      "MIN",           0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    !
                    
                      
      "MAX",           0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    !
                    
                      
      "Q1",            1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    217

      "Q3",            1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    !
                    
                      
      "LCL_MEAN",      2,

      "UCL_MEAN",      2,

                    !
                    
                      
      "LCL_GeoMEAN",   2,

                    !
                    
                      
      "UCL_GeoMEAN",   2

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    
                    
                      
    ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.univar.statlist.default =

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    !
                    
                      
      statlist(c("N", "MEANSD", "MEDIAN", "RANGE", "IQRANGE")),

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.freq.statlist.default = statlist(c("n (x.x)")),

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.nested_freq.statlist.default = statlist(c("n (x.x)")),

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.denoms.message = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    
                    
                      
    # Do not document. This is just used for testing

                    !
                    
                      
    tidytlg.add_datetime = TRUE

                    		
                  

                  

                    230
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    231
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    232
                    !
                    
                      
  toset <- !(names(op_tidytlg) %in% names(op))

                    		
                  

                  

                    233
                    !
                    
                      
  if (any(toset)) options(op_tidytlg[toset])

                    		
                  

                  

                    234
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    235
                    !
                    
                      
  invisible()

                    		
                  

                  

                    236
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Removes no-op padding from an RTF markup

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Removes no-op padding, which is padding that has a thickness of zero

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' from an RTF markup.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param rtf `character(1)` RTF markup.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @return `character(1)` RTF markup with removed zero padding

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
remove_zero_padding <- function(rtf) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    22x
                    
                      
  noop_padding <- function(direction) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    88x
                    
                      
    sprintf(r"{\\clpadf%s3\\clpad%s0 }", direction, direction)

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    22x
                    
                      
  for (direction in c("l", "r", "b", "t")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    88x
                    
                      
    rtf <- stringr::str_replace_all(rtf, noop_padding(direction), "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    22x
                    
                      
  rtf

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Add the `newrows` variable to the results dataframe.

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' The `newrows` variable is used by `gentlg()` to define when to add a blank row

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' to the output. Data will be grouped by `anbr` and the variables passed into

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' the `tableby` and `groupby` parameters. `newrows` will be set to 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' for the first record in each group, except for the first row in the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' The first row will always be set to 0.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param df dataframe of results. must contain the `anbr` variable that is

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' added by [add_format()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tableby character vector containing table by variables used to

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' generate the results.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param groupby character vector containing group by variables used to

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' generate the results.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @return dataframe with the variable `newrows` and `roworder` added.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' `newrows` is used by `gentlg` to insert line breaks.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' # Example showing how newrows is set to one for each new anbr except

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' # the first

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' tbl <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   structure(

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'     list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'       rowvar = c("RANDFL", "AGE", "AGE", "AGE", "AGE", "AGE"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'       anbr = c(1L, 2L, 2L, 2L, 2L, 2L),

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'       label = c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'         "Analysis set: Subjects Randomized", "Age (Years)", "N",

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'         "Mean (SD)", "Range", "IQ Range"

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'       ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'       row_type = c("COUNT", "UNIVAR", "UNIVAR", "UNIVAR", "UNIVAR", "UNIVAR")

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'     ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'     row.names = c(NA, -6L),

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'     class = c("tbl_df", "tbl", "data.frame")

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' add_newrows(tbl)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' # Example of use when you have results summarized by one or more variables

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' tbl2 <- tibble::tribble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'   ~anbr, ~SEX, ~label, ~row_type,

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "Sex : F", "TABLE_BY_HEADER",

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "<65", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "65-80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", ">80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "Sex : M", "TABLE_BY_HEADER",

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "<65", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "65-80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", ">80", "VALUE"

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' add_newrows(tbl2, tableby = "SEX")

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' tbl3 <- tibble::tribble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'   ~anbr, ~SEX, ~ETHNIC, ~label, ~row_type,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", NA, "Sex : F", "TABLE_BY_HEADER",

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "BY_HEADER1",

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "<65", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", ">80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "65-80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "BY_HEADER1",

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "<65", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "65-80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "F", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", ">80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", NA, "Sex : M", "TABLE_BY_HEADER",

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "BY_HEADER1",

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "<65", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", "65-80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "HISPANIC OR LATINO", ">80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "BY_HEADER1",

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "<65", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", "65-80", "VALUE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
#'   "01", "M", "NOT HISPANIC OR LATINO", ">80", "VALUE"

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
#' add_newrows(tbl3, tableby = "SEX", groupby = "ETHNIC")

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
add_newrows <- function(df, tableby = NULL, groupby = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    10x
                    
                      
  dfn <- df %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    10x
                    
                      
    dplyr::group_by_at(c(tableby, groupby, "anbr")) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    10x
                    
                      
    dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    10x
                    
                      
      roworder = dplyr::row_number(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    10x
                    
                      
      newrows =

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    10x
                    
                      
        dplyr::case_when(

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    10x
                    
                      
          .data$roworder == 1 ~ 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    10x
                    
                      
          row_type == "TABLE_BY_HEADER" ~ 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    10x
                    
                      
          TRUE ~ 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
    ) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    10x
                    
                      
    dplyr::ungroup() %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    10x
                    
                      
    dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    10x
                    
                      
      newrows = ifelse(dplyr::row_number() == 1, 0, .data$newrows),

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    10x
                    
                      
      newrows = ifelse(lag(newrows, na = 0) == 1 &

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    10x
                    
                      
        row_type == "BY_HEADER2", 0, newrows) # nolint indentation_linter

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    10x
                    
                      
  if ("nested_level" %in% names(dfn)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    !
                    
                      
    dfn %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(newrows = case_when(

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    !
                    
                      
        row_type == "NESTED" &

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    !
                    
                      
          nested_level == 0 ~ 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    !
                    
                      
        TRUE ~ newrows

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
      ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    10x
                    
                      
    dfn

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
is_listing <- function(type) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    59x
                    
                      
  substr(tolower(type), 1, 1) == "l"

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
is_table <- function(type) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    81x
                    
                      
  substr(tolower(type), 1, 1) == "t"

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
is_graph <- function(type) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    136x
                    
                      
  substr(tolower(type), 1, 1) %in% c("g", "f")

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
is_format_rtf <- function(format) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    289x
                    
                      
  tolower(format) == "rtf"

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
is_format_html <- function(format) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    23x
                    
                      
  tolower(format) == "html"

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Create a `statlist` interface for a table

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' The `statlist` is the interface for the presentation of data in a `tidytlg`

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' table.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param stats (required) A character vector of statistics to display in the

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'   table.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... (optional) Additional configuration for stats. See sections below

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   for allowable arguments.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @section `Statlists` for `freq()` and `nested_freq()`:

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' `freq()` `statlists` can be composed of `n` (count), `N` (denominator), and

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' `x.x` (percentage, formatted with or without a percent sign).

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' Denominators will include missing values if the 'display_missing'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' argument is `TRUE`, otherwise they will be excluded. They can be arranged

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' in the following ways:

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`n`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`n/N`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`n (x.x)`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`n (x.x%)`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`n/N (x.x)`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`n/N (x.x%)`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' The following other configurations are supported:

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`denoms_by` - Controls what groupings of variables should define the

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'     denominator. Variables should be passed as a quoted vector}

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`distinct` - A boolean value. Should the numerator reflect distinct

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'     `USUBJIDs` or event counts. Defaults to `TRUE` which captures distinct

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'     subjects.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'    \item{`distinct_by` - A character value used to select the variable that

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'    should be used to "distinct" the frequency tables. Defaults to `USUBJID`.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`zero_denom` - The string to display when there are no records found

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'     in an entire denominator group. Defaults to `-`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`zero_n` - The string to display when there are no records found for

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'     a numerator. Defaults to `0`.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @section `Statlists` for `univar` `statlists`:

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`N`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`SUM`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MEAN`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`GeoMEAN`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`SD`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`SE`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`CV`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`GSD`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`GSE`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MEANSD`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MEANSE`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MEDIAN`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MIN`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MAX`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`RANGE`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`Q1`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`Q3`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`IQRANGE`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MEDRANGE`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MEDIQRANGE`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`MEAN_CI`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{`GeoMEAN_CI`}

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#'   where `GeoMEAN`: Geometric Mean, `CV`: Coefficient of Variation,

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#'   `GSD`: Geometric standard deviation, `GSE`: Geometric standard error,

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#'   `MEAN_CI`: Mean (95% C.I.), `GeoMEAN_CI`: Geometric Mean (95% C.I.).

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#'   In calculating geometric statistics, if there

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#'   are zero values in the inputs, zero values will be excluded before

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#'   calculating geometric statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A `statlist` object that can be passed in the `statlist` argument of

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
#'   `freq`, `nested_freq`, or `univar`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
#' freq(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
#'   mtcars,

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
#'   colvar = "gear",

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
#'   rowvar = "cyl",

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
#'   rowbyvar = "am",

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
#'   statlist = statlist("n/N (x.x)",

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#'     distinct = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#'     denoms_by = c("gear", "am"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
#'     zero_denom = "_0_"

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
statlist <- function(stats, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
  # Validate Here

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    74x
                    
                      
  st <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    74x
                    
                      
  st$stats <- stats

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    74x
                    
                      
  structure(append(st, list(...)), class = c("statlist", "list"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' SAS rounding in R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' `roundSAS` is an alternative rounding function, ensuring that decimals equal or

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' bigger than 5 are rounded upwards to the nearest number and returned as

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' character vector.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' At the midpoint of a decimal place (e.g. 0.5, 1.5), the round function in R

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' rounds to the nearest even number (i.e. 0.5 is rounded to 0; 1.5 is rounded

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' to 2), whereas SAS rounds to the nearest number (i.e. 0.5 is rounded to 1;

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' 1.5 is rounded to 2). The `roundSAS` function is an alternative rounding

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' function for R that ensures rounding to the nearest number, as done in SAS.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' `roundSAS` comes from this Stack Overflow

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' [post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12688717/round-up-from-5).

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x Numeric vector.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param digits An integer specifying the number of decimal places to be

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   displayed after rounding. Default is 0.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param as_char logical value indicating conversion of rounded numerical

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   vector to character vector; default is `FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param na_char A character string indicating missing value; if not specified,

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   `"NA"` is created.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @return character vector of rounded values

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' ### input data vector with midpoint decimals

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' x <- c(-2.5, -1.5, -0.5, 0.5, 1.5, 2.5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' ### rounds to integer

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' roundSAS(x, digits = 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' ### input data vector with a missing value

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' y <- c(8.65, 8.75, NA, 9.85, 9.95)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' ### rounds to tenths and label the missing value with "NE"

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' roundSAS(y, digits = 1, as_char = TRUE, na_char = "NE")

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
roundSAS <- function(x, # nolint object_name_linter

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
                     digits = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
                     as_char = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
                     na_char = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
  # perform SAS rounding ----------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2800x
                    
                      
  posneg <- sign(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    2800x
                    
                      
  z <- abs(x) * 10^digits

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    2800x
                    
                      
  z <- z + 0.5 + sqrt(.Machine$double.eps)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2800x
                    
                      
  z <- trunc(z)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    2800x
                    
                      
  z <- (z / 10^digits)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2800x
                    
                      
  z <- ifelse(!is.na(z) & z > 0, z * posneg, z)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
  # output rounded values ---------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2800x
                    
                      
  if (as_char && is.null(na_char)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
    ## convert rounded values to character vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    66x
                    
                      
    formatC(z, format = "f", digits = digits)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2734x
                    
                      
  } else if (as_char && !is.null(na_char)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
    ## convert to character vector and use na_char for missing value

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2732x
                    
                      
    formatC(z, format = "f", digits = digits) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    2732x
                    
                      
      str_replace(" *(NA|NaN|NULL)", na_char)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
    ## return numeric vector of rounded values

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    2x
                    
                      
    z

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
}
